mortar

    • Constructor Detail

      • Presenter

        public Presenter()

    • Method Detail

      • takeView

        public final void takeView(V view)
        Called to give this presenter control of a view, ideally from View.onFinishInflate(). If a view is to be re-used, make an additional call from View.onAttachedToWindow(). (Redundant calls will safely no-op.) Sets the view that will be returned from getView().

        This presenter will be immediately registered (or re-registered) with the given view's scope, leading to an immediate call to onLoad(android.os.Bundle).

        It is expected that dropView(Object) will be called with the same argument when the view is no longer active, e.g. from View.onDetachedFromWindow().

        See Also:
        BundleService.register(mortar.bundler.Bundler)

      • dropView

        public void dropView(V view)
        Called to surrender control of this view, e.g. when the view is detached. If and only if the given view matches the last passed to takeView(V), the reference to the view is cleared.

        Mismatched views are a no-op, not an error. This is to provide protection in the not uncommon case that dropView and takeView are called out of order. For example, an activity's views are typically inflated in android.app.Activity#onCreate, but are only detached some time after onExitScope. It's possible for a view from one activity to be detached well after the window for the next activity has its views inflated—that is, after the next activity's onResume call.

      • getMortarBundleKey

        protected java.lang.String getMortarBundleKey()

      • extractBundleService

        protected abstract BundleService extractBundleService(V view)
        Called by takeView(V). Given a view instance, return its MortarScope.

      • getView

        protected final V getView()
        Returns the view managed by this presenter, or null if takeView(V) has never been called, or after dropView(V).

      • hasView

        protected final boolean hasView()
        Returns:
        true if this presenter is currently managing a view, or false if takeView(V) has never been called, or after dropView(V).

      • onEnterScope

        protected void onEnterScope(MortarScope scope)
        Like Bundler.onEnterScope(mortar.MortarScope).

      • onLoad

        protected void onLoad(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Like Bundler.onLoad(android.os.Bundle), but called only when getView() is not null, and debounced. That is, this method will be called exactly once for a given view instance, at least until that view is dropped. See takeView(V) for details.

      • onSave

        protected void onSave(android.os.Bundle outState)
        Like Bundler.onSave(android.os.Bundle).

      • onExitScope

        protected void onExitScope()
        Like Bundler.onExitScope(). One subtlety to note is that a presenter may be created by a higher level scope than the one it is registered with, in which case it may receive multiple calls to this method.
